Title:
Heliantheae sensu lato (Asteraceae), clades and
classification.
Abstract:
The interrelationships within the Heliantheae s. lato and
the closely related Eupatorieae are analyzed and discussed. The basis to
this discussion is a cladistic analysis of 141 morphological characters
(172 apomorphic states) scored for 97 genera. The Heleniae s. lato, a
subgroup of the Heliantheae s. lato, are paraphyletic, and a
monophyletic group corresponding largely to the Heliantheae s. str. is
recognized. The Ecliptinae sensu ROBINSON are polyphyletic. The
Coreopsidinae form an ingroup in the Heliantheae s. str. The Tageteae
(Pectidinae) and the Madieae (Madiinae) are two separate branches within
the helenioida assemblage of taxa.
